habitat_description:
This species occurs in most of the west-central and southwestern California, also ranging north to Shasta County. Most populations are established west of the Cascade and Sierra. Nevada highlands. It also occurs in northwestern localities of Baja California (Leache et al. 2009 (as referenced by Natureserve.org). Isolated populations have been reported at Grasshopper Flat, Siskiyou County, California (Grismer 2002; Jennings 1988; Stebbins 2003). 

Jennings (1988) documented failed introductions at Yosemite Valley and San Clemente Island in California, Hawaii, Guatemala, and Colombia.

The preferred habitats of this lizard include forests, grassland, savanna, chaparral, and conifer and hardwood woodlands. It is commonly found in areas with sandy and loose soils usually associated with ant colonies (Grismer 2002; Stebbins 2003).

Found in scrubland, chaparral, savanna, grassland, coniferous woods, and broadleaf woodlands.
